member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.DialogDebuggerVisualizer.Show(Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IDialogVisualizerService,Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider)
member.param: An object of type , which provides methods your visualizer can use to display Windows forms, controls, and dialogs.
An object of type . This object provides communication from the debugger side of the visualizer to the object source () on the debuggee side.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IDialogVisualizerService.ShowDialog(System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog)
member.param: Any dialog derived from System.Windows.Forms.CommonDialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IDialogVisualizerService.ShowDialog(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.param: Any control derived from System.Windows.Forms.Control.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IDialogVisualizerService.ShowDialog(System.Windows.Forms.Form)
member.param: Any Windows Form object derived from System.Windows.Forms.Form.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.GetData
member.returns: A stream of data containing the contents of the object being visualized. Calling this method results in being called on the VisualizerObjectSource. The return value of that GetData call is then returned to the caller of this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.GetObject
member.returns: The data object being visualized. This is actually a debugger-side copy of the object you are visualizing in the debuggee. If you modify the contents of this object, the changes will not be reflected back in the debuggee unless you use the / or /.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.IsObjectReplaceable
member.returns: Determines whether the data object being visualized is replaceable (read/write) or nonreplaceable (read only).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.ReplaceData(System.IO.Stream)
member.param: A stream containing data to be used to create a new object, replacing the object currently being visualized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.ReplaceObject(System.Object)
member.param: The new object to replace the object currently being visualized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.TransferData(System.IO.Stream)
member.returns: Returns the data stream filled in by VisualizerObjectSource's TransferData method. There is no two-way stream-based communication between the debugger side and debuggee side (object source.)
member.param: A stream of data that is to be transferred back to the debuggee side.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.IVisualizerObjectProvider.TransferObject(System.Object)
member.returns: The result of deserializing the return value of .
member.param: An object that is to be transferred back to the debuggee side.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerDevelopmentHost.#ctor(System.Object,System.Type)
member.param: The data object you want to show in the visualizer. If you are testing a String visualizer, for example, this parameter would be a String that you want to show in the visualizer.
The type of the class, written by you, that creates the visualizer.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerDevelopmentHost.#ctor(System.Object,System.Type,System.Type)
member.param: The data object you want to show in the visualizer. If you are testing a String visualizer, for example, this parameter would be a String that you want to show in the visualizer.
The type of the class, written by you, that creates the visualizer.
The type of a proxy object derived from .

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerDevelopmentHost.#ctor(System.Object,System.Type,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.param: The data object you want to show in the visualizer. If you are testing a String visualizer, for example, this parameter would be a String that you want to show in the visualizer.
The type of the class, written by you, that creates the visualizer.
The type of a proxy object derived from .
This Boolean value determines the visualizer can replace (edit) the data object. Setting this value to false tells the visualizer host to treat the data object as read-only.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerDevelopmentHost.ShowVisualizer(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.param: A control that you want the visualizer parented to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerDevelopmentHost.ShowVisualizer(System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window)
member.param: A window that you want the visualizer parented to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerObjectSource.CreateReplacementObject(System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.returns: An object, with contents constructed from the incoming data stream, that can replace the object. This method does not actually replace but rather provides a replacement object for the debugger to do the actual replacement.
member.param: Object being visualized.
Incoming data stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerObjectSource.Deserialize(System.IO.Stream)
member.returns: An object constructed from the data in .
member.param: Incoming object stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerObjectSource.GetData(System.Object,System.IO.Stream)
member.param: Object being visualized.
Outgoing data stream.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerObjectSource.Serialize(System.IO.Stream,System.Object)
member.param: Outgoing data stream.
Object being visualized.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.DebuggerVisualizers.VisualizerObjectSource.TransferData(System.Object,System.IO.Stream,System.IO.Stream)
member.param: Object being visualized.
Incoming data stream from the debugger side.
Outgoing data stream going to the debugger side.
